data.title: The Cable Guy | Full Movie | Movies Anywhere
data.meta_description: Purchase The Cable Guy on digital and stream instantly or download offline. Jim Carrey is Chip Douglas, cable installer. Raised on television sitcoms, he wants life to look just like My Three Sons. And when he meets single guy Steven Kovacs (Matthew Broderick), he sees his chance for some serious male bonding. But Chip's idea of friendship - which includes physical assault, a game of 'Porno Password' and a medieval joust - may be hazardous to Steven's health. In Chip's own immortal words, "I can be your best friend... or your worst enemy." Directed by Ben Stiller (Reality Bites).
data.text:
...on the whole The Cable Guy is about as subversive a mainstream comedy as youâ€™ll find...

June 14, 2022

As with Reality Bites two years earlier, director Stiller makes some astute observations about Generation X and its love of television - and media in general.

July 20, 2021

Just on paper Chip is an unsettling character, but it's Carrey who really brings him to horrifying life.

June 16, 2021

The hook to this weirdly compelling film is its teasing nature as a comedy of terrors.

May 12, 2020

Sure, in the title role [Carrey] plays another in-your-face, over-the-top, wild and crazy guy. But for once he is not a lovable goof. He is a rather unsavory psychotic. And the movie itself is not pure farce: it is satire, with a disturbing edge.

March 22, 2019

The Cable Guy is a gutsy move on Carrey's part, suggesting a willingness to grow just where commercial good sense would say to stand pat.

March 11, 2019

While it makes a convincing case that too much television is ultimately brain-rotting, it does so with an unjustifiable smugness.

March 11, 2019

This is a darker film for Carrey, but he's still Jim Carrey. His shenanigans keep even the blackest moments goofy.

March 11, 2019

As a supposed summer blockbuster, this is a very eccentric film: The Cable Guy mocks its star as a pathetic jerk and comes close to telling its audience that we are, too.

March 11, 2019
